title: firefox keeps dropping my passwords and then wants me to sync again and again.  How can I not have to sync
content: I work on fire fox and then one time I open firefox it does not remember my passwords and I have to resign on to firefox and it asks me to sync. I do have firefox on my android tablet and android phone so why do I have to keep signing on and resyncing I don't want to sync I just want to open firefox and have it remember my passwords. This continually making me sign in to my my home page account is making me angry
creator: kcg5455

title: saved logins and passwords wiped, erased, deleted, lost
content:
Very similar to posts in previous years that are archived and largely unanswered or not up-to-date.

I opened up my a Firefox session to find out I was logged out of sync and when I logged back in all my passwords where erased.

This has been stable for the last 10 months and Firefox has provided a reliable password archive with nice syncing features. However, this is a deal breaker, since I cannot loose the login credentials randomly.

No updates. No conscious logging out. No disregarding warnings etc.

Anyway to revert or retrieve?
creator: ambein

title: Firefox problems
content: I've been using Firefox for a long time, also DDG (DuckDuckGo) as my search and homepage. However, I've noticed lately that I am not able to save any setting for the browser? I've turned off the DDG one's I don't want, and a few others, and yet once I close the browser down and reopen later, he standard settings are back?? I do save settings and exit when I have made the changes I want in the settings on the Firefox browser, so why aren't they saving ?? GRrrrr
creator: 16emtec

title: No screenshot facility in Firefox 95.0.2 under windows 10
content:
I have today commissioned a new HP laptop running Windows 10.

I have downloaded Firefox and done a straightforward installation. I have viewed a couple of web pages but notice that when right clicking there is no longer a screenshot facility in the little menu box that appears. Trying Control + Shift + S does not work either.

I am writing this using Firefox 93.0 for Linux Mint on an old Toshiba Satellite and I have the facility - both right click and keyboard.

Has the facility been discontinued in the later version?

Many thanks in advance
creator: number.six

title: Right mouse click & move now opens popup with MouseUp in web app.
content:
In the editor of an online web application that I use (easyeda.com) there is the pan function by right click & drag. I haven't used it for a few months but now on the MouseUp when I finish panning the workspace the normal browser right click popup appears. Pretty sure it didn't do this before, am wondering if it due to a FF update or the vendors app needs to disable this on the MouseUp event. Its just annoying, I pan a lot !!, not stopping my workflow.

FireFox for win, Win7p_x64,
creator: tonigau

title: save cookie exception list not working right in OS Monterey
